text:
From the logs
https://circleci.com/gh/nilearn/nilearn/1333
it seems that we are running the unit tests on circleCI. I think that we should skip them: they are already ran on travis, and I would really like the circleCI total time to be smaller.
title: Running tests on circleCI

text: @sahmed95 : possibly. Do you want to do a pull request to try? CircleCI will run that PR and we should see.

> But I was just wondering why you have both travis and circleCI ? Isn't
> one CI sufficient ?

CircleCI has much more horse power, both in terms of storage and length
of the runs. We use it to generate/test docs. Travis is for unit testing.

> Showing an estimate Estimated: 1:38:26. How much time did a circleCI test take
> before?

This is irrelevant, I believe: the estimate is based only on the past
runs.

> Also, from the circleCI docs : "CircleCI supports the use of override,
> pre, and/or post in the test section. All test commands will run, even
> if one fails" If there are nosetest commands by default in the pre or
> post sections, then those should be ignored too I guess ?

I guess. I don't know. I didn't have time to look at this so far.
